body:
I'd want to label "helm releases" to efficiently retrieve only part of helm releases.

To achieve that, I'm imagining at least one enhancement to `helm list`. That is to accept `--selector key1=val1` or `-l key1=val1` like `kubectl get RESOURCE -l key1=val1` does. `helm list -l key1=val` shows helm releases that matches the selector. In this case it means those labeled `key1: val1` onto their underlying configmaps(or secrets) that tiller created to store the releases info.

## Initial U/X

Today what tiller creates for a helm release named `httpserver` looks like this:

```
  kind: ConfigMap
  metadata:
    creationTimestamp: 2018-09-09T05:44:08Z
    labels:
      MODIFIED_AT: "1536471850"
      NAME: httpserver
      OWNER: TILLER
      STATUS: DEPLOYED
      VERSION: "1"
    name: httpserver.v1
```

You can label the configmap by:

```
kubectl label configmap httpserver.v1 tier=web
```

So that, with the new `-l` flag added to `helm list`, I can list only `web` related releases:

```
helm list -l tier=web
```

## Detailed Specs

### How release labels are implemented in release configmaps/escrets

Note that I intentionally opted to not add a UPPSER_CASE prefixes to labels.

Instead of the below:

```
  kind: ConfigMap
  metadata:
    creationTimestamp: 2018-09-09T05:44:08Z
    labels:
      MODIFIED_AT: "1536471850"
      NAME: httpserver
      OWNER: TILLER
      STATUS: DEPLOYED
      VERSION: "1"
      RELEASE_LABEL_tier: web
    name: httpserver.v1
```

I would see:

```
  kind: ConfigMap
  metadata:
    creationTimestamp: 2018-09-09T05:44:08Z
    labels:
      MODIFIED_AT: "1536471850"
      NAME: httpserver
      OWNER: TILLER
      STATUS: DEPLOYED
      VERSION: "1"
      tier: web
    name: httpserver.v1
```

So that we can use the same infrastructure to implement features like https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/4143#issuecomment-393226417 (cc/ @rcorre). That is, `helm helm ls --namespace MYNS` becomes equivalent to `helm list -l NAMESPACE=MYNS`.

## Future Works

Personally I'm ok with also implementing ways to add labels to the release at installation time. `helm install mycharts/httpserver -l tier=web`, and `helm upgrade --install mycharts/httpserver -l tier=web`.

For feature parity with kubernetes labels, `helm label RELEASE K=V` would also make sense.

Also, `kubectl label` allows you to remove labels by using `-` suffix, e.g. `kubectl label configmap NAME K-`. If we get to implement the `helm label` command, it would be nice to also add support for removing label.

However, I intentionally leave these as future works for now, to make the scope of this feature request minimum, and ease implementing the MVP.
